meanings.definition: The quality of being worthy of esteem or respect.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness and honesty are estimablenesses that everyone admires.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's patience and dedication are estimablenesses that make her a role model.
meanings.sent3: His estimablenesses shine through in the way he always helps others without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent4: The estimablenesses of her character are like a beacon of light in a world full of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The estimablenesses of his actions left a lasting impression on everyone who knew him.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to be estimated or valued.
meanings.sent1: The estimablenesses of the antique vase made it a valuable item at the auction.
meanings.sent2: In the world of finance, accurately determining the estimablenesses of assets is crucial.
meanings.sent3: The estimablenesses of the rare gemstone were carefully assessed by experts before auction.
meanings.sent4: She possessed a keen eye for recognizing the estimablenesses of different artworks.
meanings.sent5: The estimablenesses of his collection were beyond measure, both in value and sentiment.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being estimable or deserving of admiration.
meanings.sent1: His estimablenesses as a leader were evident in the way he inspired his team.
meanings.sent2: The estimablenesses of her courage in the face of adversity were truly remarkable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his estimablenesses, he remained humble and never sought recognition.
meanings.sent4: The estimablenesses of her talent were recognized by all who witnessed her performance.
meanings.sent5: The estimablenesses of their friendship stood the test of time and challenges.
